instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Upgrading storage on new MacBooks
threads.message:
In the past few days I have had a few customers ask about upgrading their storage size on the new MacBooks with NAND storage, is this something I should learn, how often other techs do this and what is the recommended practice? 

So far I just tell them that we don't do it.

threads.title: Upgrading storage on new MacBooks
threads.message:
I'm sure videos available on Internet.
But you must consider the risk supposed by this process.
You can end with non-working board, and probably the client will claim for free replacment.
Think about the money needed to buy necessary pieces, time involved and risk.

threads.title: Upgrading storage on new MacBooks
threads.message: Thanks a lot, that makes sense, we will continue to say no for those same reasons.
